question: Peanuts are not nuts!
A_D: Peanuts are legumes like lentils and peas.

question: Rhea was the mother of the Greek god Zeus
The Big Apple is a nickname given to Washington D.C in 1971.
A_D: The name refers to New York City

question: People may sneeze or cough while sleeping deeply.
A_D: We can’t sneeze or cough when in deep sleep. Our body must enter a state of wakefulness to do so.

question: Copyrights depreciate over time.
A_D: Because copyrights have an expiration date, their value decreases as that date approaches.

question: Emus can’t fly.
A_D: Just like ostriches. Their wings aren’t strong enough to lift them.

question: There is no snow on Minecraft.
A_D: Snow was added to Minecraft in 2010. It generates naturally in rare ice plains, spikes, and biomes.

question: Light travels in a straight line.
A_D: Light travels in a straight line until it meets an obstacle that can influence its angle.

question: The Mona Liza was stolen from the Louvre in 1911.
A_D: It was stolen by Vincenzo Peruggia who had worked at the Museum. The masterpiece was recovered two years later.

question: The film Moneyball is based on a true story.
A_D: The film is based on the story of Billy Beane, Oakland A’s General Manager, who used statistics to scout players and turn his team around.

question: A credit card and a debit card are the same.
A_D: A debit card allows you to spend money by drawing on funds in your bank account, while a credit card allows you to spend money by borrowing from the card issuer up to a certain limit.

question: Ethereum is the second-largest cryptocurrency after Bitcoin.
A_D: Ethereum is a decentralized, open-source blockchain with smart contract functionality. It’s also the most actively used blockchain.
